title: Garry Monk protests Cardiff City's late strike which leaves Sheffield Wednesday deflated
text:
Cardiff City 1-1 Sheffield Wednesday

Garry Monk believes the officials robbed his Sheffield Wednesday side of three points after Lee Tomlin’s stunning free-kick halted their march to the automatic promotion places.

The midfielder curled his shot into the bottom corner from 25 yards to cancel out a first half goal for Wednesday by Julian Borner. It was enough to preserve Cardiff’s unbeaten home record this season and rescue a point for Cardiff, which had seemed beyond them.

But Monk was left bemused by the officials after Aden Flint impeded the view of goalkeeper Cameron Dawson from an offside position as Tomlin struck.

“If it had been a legitimate goal, fair enough, but I am told it wasn’t even a foul for the free-kick,” he said. “Then, they had one of their players doing star jumps, trying to distract our keeper.

“How they missed that, I don’t know – because it’s not hard to spot – a 6ft 5 inch player doing star jumps. But there we are – it is what it is.” Harris – who was deemed surplus to Neil Warnock’s requirements in the summer and left on a free transfer – was the provider for Wednesday’s Borner. His driven 19th minute shot – turned in by the German Borner – was eventually cancelled out by Tomlin, something of a free-kick specialist himself.
